incidents.name: Customers Invoice sections incorrectly refer to [ROOT PRICE]

incident_updates.body: Invoices issued for January 2023, for approximately 90,000 customers, included a ROOT PRICING text in some of the SKU Group grouping texts. This was unexpected and caused confusion for some customers, who were on a custom pricing plan and inferred they were not getting that plan. There was no impact to usage or invoicing values calculated, sent to customers or tracked through our systems, this was a presentation problem with SKU Group descriptions only.

incidents.name: On Call Engineers are Investigating

incident_updates.body: We have fully investigated the potential issue with console phone numbers 504s issue, and it was determined that the impact was limited to a small set of customers, who have been contacted individually to address any concerns. All systems are operational.

affected_components.name: PHONE NUMBERS

incident_updates.body: Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with console phone numbers 504s. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

affected_components.name: PHONE NUMBERS

incidents.name: Elevated 500 responses on POST to /Calls

incident_updates.body: During the time period 23:24 to 23:27 UTC we observed an elevated rate of 500 response codes on the /Calls endpoint. The service is currently restored and no other products were impacted during the time window. This incident is retroactive.

incidents.name: Reporting Delays For Super SIM Connection Events and Usage Records

incident_updates.body:
We are no longer experiencing reporting delay issues for Super SIM Connection Events and Usage Records in the DE1 and SG1 regions this issue has been resolved.

However, while attempting to replay Super SIM Connection Events and Usage Records that were not published during the incident, we have identified an issue that prevents us from completing the process. 

Unfortunately, this means that the events that were not published are lost and cannot be recovered. We estimated that the incident affected around 100% of devices that were connected to the SG1 internet breakout region (using APN sg1.super) between March 1st 8 AM UTC and March 2nd 10:30 AM UTC, and about 11% of devices connected to the DE1 internet breakout region (using APN de1.super) between March 2nd 8AM UTC and March 2nd 10:30AM UTC.

affected_components.name: INTERNET OF THINGS - Super SIM

incident_updates.body: We have successfully mitigated the reporting delay issue for Super SIM Connection Events and Usage Records in the DE1 and SG1 regions. New Connection Events and Usage Records will be published again in near real time for devices connected in those regions. We are continuing to work on the process to replay events that were not published during the incident and will provide an update once the process is complete. Please note that this incident did not impact connectivity. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: INTERNET OF THINGS - Super SIM

incident_updates.body: We have successfully mitigated the reporting delay issue for Super SIM Connection Events and Usage Records in the DE1 and SG1 regions. New Connection Events and Usage Records will be published again in near real time for devices connected in those regions. We are currently starting the process to replay those events that were not published during the incident and will provide an update once the process is complete. Please note that this incident did not impact connectivity. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: INTERNET OF THINGS - Super SIM

incident_updates.body: We are experiencing reporting delays for Super SIM Connection Events and Usage Records in the DE1 and SG1 region. The issue started on Wednesday 1st of March at 00:00 PT for devices connected in SG1, and on Thursday 2nd of March at 00:00 PT for devices connected in DE1. The issue has been identified and we are actively working on restoring the service. The issue has no impact on connectivity. We are working to identify the source of the delay. We will provide another update in 1 hour or sooner once more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: INTERNET OF THINGS - Super SIM
